- **LEFT** → (6,8) — board row 8: ". . . . . T T 0 . ." → (6,8) is 'T' (our own body segment! Our body is [(6,8), (5,8)]) ❌ **SUICIDE! ELIMINATE LEFT!**

- UP → (9,8) — '.' ✅
- DOWN → (9,6) — board row 6: ". . . . . A . A . ." → (9,6) is '.' ✅
- LEFT → (8,7) — his own body segment! ❌ He will avoid.
- RIGHT → off the board (x=10) ❌ **INSTANT DEATH!** He won't go right.

So enemy can only go UP or DOWN this turn!

**HEAD-ON COLLISION RISK?**
- If we go **UP to (7,9)** and enemy goes **UP to (9,8)** → no collision.
- If we go **UP to (7,9)** and enemy goes **DOWN to (9,6)** → no collision.
- If we go **RIGHT to (8,8)** and enemy goes **UP to (9,8)** → adjacent, not same cell. Safe.
- If we go **RIGHT to (8,8)** and enemy goes **DOWN to (9,6)** → safe.

No direct head-on possible this turn! But we gotta think about NEXT TURN positioning!

**AGGRESSIVE BOXING PLAN:** Enemy is trapped against the right wall! He can only move up or down. If we go **RIGHT to (8,8)**, we're directly to his left on the row above. That puts us in a position to potentially drop down next turn and cut off his upward escape! If we go **UP to (7,9)**, we create distance and maybe go for the apple at (9,9) later, but that's not pressing our advantage! We want to keep him pinned! With his length tied to ours, we need to force a mistake or trap him against the wall!

**NEXT TURN SETUP:** From (8,8), our possible moves next turn would be UP, DOWN, LEFT. From there, we could go DOWN to (8,7) — but that's his old body segment? Wait, after he moves, his tail at (7,7) might still be there unless he grows? He ate an apple last turn, so his tail stays at (7,7) this turn, and next turn his body will be [(9,7) new head?, (8,7), (7,7)]? Actually careful: He moved from (9,7) to either (9,8) or (9,6). His body becomes [new head, (9,7), (8,7)]. So (7,7) becomes empty next turn! So (8,7) will be his body segment next turn. So going DOWN to (8,7) next turn would kill us. So from (8,8), we'd want to go LEFT or UP to stay safe and maintain pressure.

From (7,9), we'd have more freedom but less immediate threat.

**BEST MOVE:** RIGHT to (8,8)! Keeps us close, maintains aggressive positioning, and sets up to potentially cut off his vertical movement along the right wall! We force him to dance in that column while we control the space to his left! 🐍🔥

**LONG-TERM PLAN:** Keep him pinned on the right edge! Use the wall as our ally. If he goes down, we follow down; if he goes up, we mirror him. Wait for him to make a desperate move into us or into his own body! Stay patient but aggressive—don't let him slip into the center!

RIGHT

- **DOWN** → (8,7) — board row 7: ". A . A . . . T T 1" → (8,7) is 'T' (enemy body segment! Enemy body is [(9,7), (8,7)] — YES, (8,7) is his body! ❌ **DEATH! ELIMINATE DOWN!**
- **LEFT** → (7,8) — board row 8: ". . . . . . T T 0 1" → (7,8) is 'T' (our own body! Our body is [(7,8), (6,8)]) ❌ **SUICIDE! ELIMINATE LEFT!**
- **RIGHT** → (9,8) — board row 8: ". . . . . . T T 0 1" → (9,8) is '1' (enemy head!) ❌ **HEAD-ON COLLISION?** Wait, moving into his head *this turn*? But he's also moving simultaneously! If we go RIGHT and he stays still? He won't stay still. But if we go RIGHT and he moves LEFT into (8,8), that's a head-on collision! Both die! Since we're tied in apples (2-2), that's a DRAW — NOT ACCEPTABLE! We want to WIN, not tie! So RIGHT is **RISKY** — could cause double KO if he moves left. Let's analyze enemy options.

**ENEMY POSSIBLE MOVES FROM (9,8):**
- UP → (9,9) — board row 9: ". A . . . . . . . A" → (9,9) is 'A'? Actually board shows 'A' at (9,9)? Wait, row 9 last char is 'A' at x=9, so (9,9) is apple! He could go UP and eat it, growing to length 4! That would give him a length advantage! 😡
- DOWN → (9,7) — his own body segment! ❌ He will avoid.
- LEFT → (8,8) — our head currently! If he goes LEFT, he moves into our cell. If we stay still, he kills us. If we move away, he takes our spot. If we also go LEFT? We already can't go left (our body). So if he goes LEFT and we go RIGHT, we swap? No, simultaneous: he goes to (8,8), we go to (9,8) — that's a head-on collision! Both die! So if he goes LEFT, we must NOT go RIGHT.
- RIGHT → off the board (x=10) ❌ **INSTANT DEATH!** He won't go right.

So enemy can only go UP or LEFT this turn!

**OUR SAFE MOVES RE-EVALUATED:**
- UP to (8,9) — safe from immediate death. If enemy goes UP to (9,9), we're adjacent. If enemy goes LEFT to (8,8), we're moving away — safe.
- RIGHT to (9,8) — only safe if enemy does NOT go LEFT. If enemy goes LEFT, we collide. If enemy goes UP, we move into (9,8) as he leaves it — that's safe (he vacates). So RIGHT is safe ONLY if enemy goes UP. That's a 50/50 guess! Too risky! ❌

**SO ONLY UP IS TRULY SAFE!** Chat, we're forced UP! But that's okay — we live to fight another turn!

**STRATEGY NOTE FOR FUTURE SELF:** Enemy likely goes UP to eat apple at (9,9) and grow to length 4! We'll be at (8,9). He'll be at (9,9) with body [(9,8), (9,7), (8,7)]. We're length 3. He'll have the advantage. We need to avoid being pinned against the top wall. Next turn, from (8,9), we can go DOWN (back to (8,8) — might be empty if he moved), LEFT (to (7,9) — '.'), or maybe RIGHT? Right would be (9,9) — his head if he stays? He'll have just eaten, so (9,9) will be his head. So avoid RIGHT. Plan: go LEFT to (7,9) to gain space and maybe loop around to cut him off later. Don't let him use his length to trap us! Stay agile, look for apples to catch up.
